abstract: Prime Min Chiril Gaburici of Moldova resigns after being questioned by state prosecutors about his academic degrees, which he says is political game; Gaburici had previously accused same prosecutors of dragging their feet in investigating disappearance of $1 billion from banks in country, which is equivalent of one-eighth of country's GDP.
lead_paragraph: Moldova’s prime minister resigned on Friday after state prosecutors questioned him over his high school and university degrees.

headline.main: Moldova: Premier Resigns Amid Queries on Diplomas
headline.print_headline: Europe; Moldova: Premier Resigns Amid Queries on Diplomas

snippet: Moldova’s prime minister resigned on Friday after state prosecutors questioned him over his high school and university degrees.
